item.description:
We will be hiking up to Mt. Pierce on the Crawford Path which is the oldest continuously maintained hiking trail in the United States. It was constructed in 1819 by Able and Ethan Allen Crawford and was later converted into a bridle path to the ridge of the Presidentials.
We will park at the parking lot for the AMC Highland Center. The trail has a cutoff that starts across the street from the Highland Center. In general, the trail is steady and moderate with no real steep sections. Snowshoes and some type of foot traction will be required. We will cross several small streams along the way as we take the trail to the summit.
The hike up to the summit is about 3.2 miles with a vertical gain of over 2100 feet. It will take between 2.5 and 3.0 hours to reach the summit. If we have a nice clear day, the summit of Washington and the rest of the Southern Presidentials will be visible from the bare rocky summit. We will return to the Highland Center via the same trail.
For those of you getting into winter hiking and interested in doing a 4000 footer, this is a good hike.
